p: The Brazilian Atlantic Forest stretches along the coast of Brazil, embracing a large latitudinal and altitudinal gradient that creates a number of different biogeographical sub-regions within the biome ( Silva, Sousa & Castelletti, 2004; Ribeiro et al., 2009). We used the geographic boundaries of the Atlantic Forest established under the Brazilian legislation (Law No. 11.428 from 22 December 2006). Our analysis included the 2,688 counties with â‰¥75% of its territory within the limits of the Atlantic Forest biome. Biome and county spatial data were downloaded from the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics ( http://downloads.ibge.gov.br/downloads_geociencias.htm).
